snippet: Replacing the 65-year-old terminal in Manhattan could cost at least $10 billion, and the project wouldn’t be finished before 2027. The short-term solution was to create a subcommittee to study the problem.
abstract: Commissioners of Port Authority of New York and New Jersey agree at public meeting that Port Authority Bus Terminal is outdated and needs to be replaced, but disagree over replacement options and cost estimates; members decide to appoint committee to study matter, with goal of reaching proposal by end of 2015.
lead_paragraph: Replacing the 65-year-old terminal in Manhattan could cost at least $10 billion, and the project wouldn’t be finished before 2027. The short-term solution was to create a subcommittee to study the problem.

headline.main: Port Authority Agrees on the Need to Replace Its Bus Terminal, but Little Else
